eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovement

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com), Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
By default, the borders of the wrapping area match the screen size, but they can be changed.

The teleport happens when the center of the object crosses a border. In the behavior properties, you can modify (increase or decrease) the margin used to trigger this teleport.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ScreenWrap
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Teleport objects leaving one side of the screen so that they immediately reappear on the opposite side, maintaining speed and trajectory.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Teleport the object when leaving one side of the screen so that it immediately reappears on the opposite side, maintaining speed and trajectory.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ScreenWrap

events.name: Move object to opposite side (if needed)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is wrapping on the left and right borders.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHorizontalWrapping

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is wrapping on the top and bottom borders.
eventsFunctions.name: IsVerticalWrapping

eventsFunctions.description: Enable wrapping on the left and right borders.
eventsFunctions.name: EnableHorizontalWrapping

eventsFunctions.description: Enable wrapping on the top and bottom borders.
eventsFunctions.name: EnableVerticalWrapping

eventsFunctions.description: Number of pixels past the center where the object teleports and appears
eventsFunctions.name: TriggerOffset

propertyDescriptors.label: Top border of wrapped area (Y).  If blank, the value will be 0.
propertyDescriptors.name: BorderTop

propertyDescriptors.label: Left border of wrapped area (X).  If blank, the value will be 0.
propertyDescriptors.name: BorderLeft

propertyDescriptors.label: Right border of wrapped area (X).  If blank, the value will be the scene width.
propertyDescriptors.name: BorderRight

propertyDescriptors.label: Bottom border of wrapped area (Y).  If blank, the value will be scene height.
propertyDescriptors.name: BorderBottom

propertyDescriptors.label: Number of pixels past the center where the object teleports and appears
propertyDescriptors.name: TriggerOffset

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: StayOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: StayOnScreen

parameters: min(max(Object.X(), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 + Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginLeft()), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginRight())

min(max(Object.Y(), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2+ Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginTop()), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2- Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginBottom())
